For a more accurate prescription exercise solution, we will need the following information. Additional information will help us personalize your exercise plan.
Start making your physical exercise more scientific and effective with REPACE at your side.!
Welcome to REPACE Prescription (Rx) Exercise Program!
Make Sure Your REPACE Device Is Turned On If It Is Fresh Out Of The Box.
By allowing access, REPACE will be able to send your activity reminders, exercise data, etc.
Please reopen the app to update the language
Check Out the Information from Your Latest Exercise

Muscle oxygenation is particularly important for both endurance and power of a muscle because it is necessary to produce ATP to power muscle cells to contract. Heart rate and blood oxygen delivery are helpful for getting an idea of an athlete\'s efficiency, but they do not tell the whole story for the muscle. 

Physical exercise performed at different intensities promotes distinct physiological responses during both activity and recovery process. High-intensity and short-volume efforts are widely used in the sports context and have also been extensively adopted in non-athlete training programs. 

REPACE Prescription (Rx) Exercise Program utilizes muscle oxygenation level measured real-time during your exercise to provide the best Exercise Program suited to your body condition. 

Start now by completing LT TEST to find out what’s best for you.

You can estimate your Lactate Onset timing simply by running in accordance with LT TEST guidance.\n\nYou can obtain a more accurate information by complying with a few simple conditions.

REPACE measures your muscle oxygenation (SmO2) while you exercise and allows you to check when your muscles have reached increased use of carbohydrates by calculating the timing of the first Lactate Onset.

Your muscles use up more oxygen in the body during exercise than when you are relaxing or resting. 

For your body to remain physically fit to endure challenging activities and improve cardiovascular fitness at the same time, it is important to delay the timing of the first Lactate Onset (i.e., rightward shift of the exponential lactate curve) by keeping up with regular exercises with intensity level just right for you. 

REPACE will help you deal with such first Lactate Onset time. Become a smart runner and perform regular LT TESTs to determine what exercise level is right for you. Follow the Prescription Exercise (Rx Exercise) recommended by REPACE and see whether first Lactate Onset time has indeed been delayed for your improving endurance. 

For best results, it is important to perform LT TEST as well as Prescription Exercises in an environment that offers consistent pace and speed, such as at a treadmill.
LT TEST takes into account the amount of exercises that you do in your daily life. REPACE measures and analyzes SmO2 shown during each LT TEST Stage.
Each Stage consists of 5minute running, and automatically ends when the targeted exercise amount is met.
For a more accurate result, Treadmill Running LT TEST is recommended.
Personalized Prescription Exercise is accessible when LT TEST is complete.
Prescription (Rx) Exercise will not be available if you press STOP at any time before LT TEST is complete

It can improve fat oxidation and regeneration of the energy, resulting in enhanced recovery ability (improving first lactate onset).

Low-intensity can improve fat oxidation and regeneration of the energy. Also, it is helpful for your weight reduction because it improves exercise substrate oxidation, energy efficiency, perceived exertion following exercise, fasting glucose-insulin homeostasis, and the fat profile.

Polarized Training elicits superior cardiorespiratory and metabolic adaptations as maximal aerobic performance (VO2max/VO2peak) compared to high-intensity interval exercise or moderate-intensity endurance training alone.
Data will not be available if you press STOP at any time before Prescription (Rx) Exercise is complete
Data will not be saved if you press STOP at any time to complete free exercise

This data represents your running speed when a sharp lactate increase up to 4mmol occurs. From this data, we recalculate your running speed when lactate started accumulating in your body. This event is called Lactate Onset. The longer you exercise without reaching Lactate Onset, the higher your endurance level is to physical challenges. Look forward to the marked improvements in your body fitness by synchronizing exercises with your Lactate Onset data.
Heartrate at the first onset point
This is a VO2 max / VO2 peak improving exercise that facilitates your fat burn and helps with weight loss.
Alternating low intensity exercise and high intensity exercise without missing sessions is recommended.
This is a competency improving exercise that facilitates your overall endurance level.
Consistent and regular exercise is recommended.
Run on a Treadmill or a Flat Outdoor Track in alternating speeds set for each designated Day.
complete another LT TEST to obtain Prescription (Rx) Exercise optimized for your current body.
Run on a Treadmill or a Flat Outdoor Track,
Check to see if REPACE device is connected via BLE
Trophies to congratulate you when you complete LT TEST

High intensity improves cardiovascular fitness as measured by maximal oxygen uptake (VO2max) and includes repeated rounds of exercise that achieve > 90% of maximal heart rate (HRmax), the second ventilatory threshold, over second lactate threshold , and > 85% of peak and maximal oxygen uptake (VO2peak and VO2max).
This is a competency improving exercise that facilitates your general endurance level (low to high-intensity exercise performance).

Alternating low-intensity exercise and high-intensity exercise without missing sessions are recommended. It is called the Polarized Training(PT) 

PT elicits superior cardiorespiratory and metabolic adaptations as maximal aerobic performance (VO2max/VO2peak) compared to high-intensity interval exercise or moderate-intensity endurance training alone. 

Also, PT is helpful for your weight reduction because it improves exercise substrate oxidation, energy efficiency, perceived exertion following exercise, fasting glucose-insulin homeostasis, and the fat profile.

Consistent and regular exercise is recommended. 

LIE can improve fat oxidation and regeneration of the energy, resulting in enhanced recovery ability (improving first lactate onset). 

This is called improving metabolic flexibility, reflecting the ability to utilize efficiently fat and carbohydrate, mitochondrial function, and aerobic capacity. 

Furthermore, LIE is helpful who train high-intensity exercises (strength and interval training). They need this recovery ability to optimize the repeated high-intensity exercise session because of the need for energy regeneration.
Insert the REPACE into the holder according to the shape of the sensor hole.
Insert it into the band so that the REPACE power button is directing upward.
Slide the band on your right thigh that the center mark on the band is place in the center of your knee.
Take a sit and straighten your legs then wear the lowermost bottom of the band is 10cm upward from the kneecap.
